intro: Acrocarpidium guildingianum, commonly known as the Chinese clubmoss, is a rare and ancient plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and a unique reproductive structure called a strobilus. This plant thrives in cool, moist environments, typically in shaded forest floors. Its sporophytes are short and stout, with a distinct club-like shape, giving it its common name. Acrocarpidium guildingianum is considered a living fossil, offering insights into the evolutionary history of early land plants.
